About Me


I'm a PhD student in Astrophysics at the Observatoire Astronomique de Strasbourg.

I am working with radiative-hydrodynamical simulations in the cosmological context of the Epoch of Reionization.
I am specially motivated by the field of high performance computing and software engineering.

Research:

I’m interested by the study of the formation of cosmic structures. Particularly at hight redshift, during the epoch of reionization.

I’m focused on the development of an adequate subrid model for star formation and stellar feedback at cosmological scale.

Projects:

I'm part of the development team of EMMA, an AMR cosmological code specialized in the study of the reionization epoch . I develop a python tool for EMMA outputs analyze named pyEMMA (available here). I am also a contributor of an online astronomical data visualization tool (not publicly available yet).

Curiculum Vitae:

My full CV is available here
